sense.name: a group of nations or people acting together with common interests
sense.commentary: BLOC[+group][+social][-temporary][+unified][+shared][+interest][+nations/+people] Note: usually implies long-term alliances or tendencies, unlike Sense 2
sense.examples: They are hoping for support from the Arab bloc of nations. It's a bloc of southern voters who have traditionally voted the Democratic ticket. It turns out he worked for the East bloc as a double agent during the Cold War.

sense.name: temporary groups of legislators who vote together
sense.commentary: BLOC[+group][+social][+temporary][+purpose][+immediate][+legislators] Note: a restricted use of Sense 1, implies short-term alliances for immediate goals
sense.examples: There may be a large enough bipartisan bloc in the Senate to defeat the bill. The congressman made a surprise switch to the conservative bloc on that issue.
